org.erlide.wrangler.refactoring.codeinspection.view
Class SWTImageCanvas

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
          org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
              org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
                  org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas
                      org.erlide.wrangler.refactoring.codeinspection.view.SWTImageCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable
public class SWTImageCanvas
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas

A scrollable image canvas that extends org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Canvas.

It requires Eclipse (version >= 2.1) on Win32/win32; Linux/gtk; MacOSX/carbon.

This implementation using the pure SWT, no UI AWT package is used. For convenience, I put everything into one class. However, the best way to implement this is to use inheritance to create multiple hierarchies.

Author:
Chengdong Li: cli4@uky.edu

syncScrollBars

public void syncScrollBars()
Synchronize the scrollbar with the image. If the transform is out of range, it will correct it. This function considers only following factors : transform, image size, client area.

public void onFileOpen()

centerZoom

public void centerZoom(double dx,
                       double dy,
                       double scale,
                       java.awt.geom.AffineTransform af)
Perform a zooming operation centered on the given point (dx, dy) and using the given scale factor. The given AffineTransform instance is preconcatenated.

Parameters:
dx - center x
dy - center y
scale - zoom rate
af - original affinetransform

zoomIn

public void zoomIn()
Zoom in around the center of client Area.

zoomOut

public void zoomOut()
Zoom out around the center of client Area.
